授業目的: Each student is expected to work on advisor-approved projects that will challenge the student to learn new things about digital technologies and use those technologies in positive ways to affect our digital society in positive manners. Although the main topic of the seminar is related to technology, not all students are expected to become technologies.  As a matter of fact, it is expected and anticipated that some of the students will work on other subjects such as technology policy and entrepreneurship.  This year, some of those technologies include table-PC platforms, smartphones, educational technologies and much more.
到達目標:
Students will:
1) Work on advisor-directed research projects
2) Learn useful research techniques based on the scientific method
3) Work on groups of 2 or more to develop their research themes more efficiently
4) Write academic undergraduate thesis using standard writing tools
5) Programming skills
6) Surveying skills
特記事項:
本授業科目は、“オンライン授業60単位制限対象科目”ではありません。
The course is not subject to the 60-credit limit for online courses.
授業の概要・背景:
学生は全ての授業に出席する必要があり、欠席は最大2回までとします。欠席する場合は少なくとも24時間以上前に私に知らせて許可を得る必要があります。

進級論文・卒業論文の研究テーマ選定を学ぶ実践的な授業です。 1年目は、進級論文研究テーマの選定、テーマの整理、チームプロジェクトにおけるチームメンバーの選定、プレゼンテーション、研究目標と成功指標の立案などを中心に学びます。 2年目は1年目のフォローアップとして、卒業論文研究プロジェクトを実現させることが期待されます。 1年次には文章での提出が求められますが、2年次には、卒論を提出するか、研究の成果物を実際にデジタルデータとして提出するか、どちらかになります。 例えば、ゲーム、音楽トラック、アニメーション、ウェブサービスなどです。

This is a hands-on class in which students will learn to select a research theme for their junior-year term papers and their senior graduation thesis. The first year focuses on selecting a research subject, organizing the subject, selecting team members for team projects, making presentations, and planning the research goals and success indicators. The second year is a follow-up to the first year, where the students are expected to bring the research project to fruition. While during the first year, the students are expected to submit their work in writing, in the second year, the students can either submit a written thesis or the actual product of their research in digital form. For example, a game, a music track, an animation, a web service, etc.
授業方法:
学生発表、個人及びチーム・プロジェクトを含む。
原則的に対面授業形式ですが、オンライン授業の許可を得ている学生のために、同時双方向型オンラインで授業します。全ての授業はZoomにて収録し、Lunaサイトで後からも見ることができます。

Requires student presentations and individual and team projects.
In essence, the class format is face-to-face, but for students who have permission for online classes, the class will be taught in a simultaneous interactive online format. All classes are recorded via Zoom and can be viewed later on the Luna site.

トピック.授業計画1:
Students are expected to attend every single seminar class meetings. There will be status updates at the beginning of those meetings in which each student will describe research and study progress during the previous week. According to the projects the students are involved in, the students will then spend the rest of the seminar class time advancing further their study and research under the close supervision of the instructor. At times, seminar meetings might take place outside of the seminar room and at times during weekends.
1) Introduction to different research topics
2) Students decide what technology team they wish to join
3) Students teams meet with professor every week to work on a specific project
4) Students present a poster that represents their work at the research consortium meeting
5) Students work on project during the rest of the spring semester
6) Students are given a set of tasks, including a reading list for the summer vacation
7) Students present a status report at the beginning of the fall semester
8) Field work
9) Students keep on working on research project
10) Students present their work at the fall research fair
11) Field work
12) Students present their projects to professor and rest of class for review
13) Field work
14) Final report is due at the end of classes in December1) Spring Research Consortium
15) Fall Research Fair
